definition: reaching the sky/for days on end/incessantly
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
to whine on for days (idiom)/to endlessly grumble complaints/incessant whining
cannon firing for days on end (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war

sentences.english: I am now at a very pleasant cottage window looking onto a beautiful hilly country, with a view of the sea.
sentences.chinese: 我正愜意地臨窗而坐，眺望遠山如黛，碧海連天。

sentences.english: Again has a look us, usually meets slightly is difficult, we all complain incessantly.
sentences.chinese: 再看看我們，平時遇到一點小困難，我們都叫苦連天。

sentences.english: The road works caused much complaint among local neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 修路工程使當地居民叫苦連天。

sentences.english: The road-works caused much complaint among local neighbours.
sentences.chinese: 修路工程使當地居民叫苦連天。

sentences.english: Everything was dirt-colored, even the sky.
sentences.chinese: 一切全是土色的，連天也一樣。
乏味的演講讓我呵欠連天。

sentences.english: Wars have been waged. Innocents have been slaughtered.
sentences.chinese: 爲此曾經戰火連天，無辜民衆慘遭屠殺。

sentences.english: Are the elevators in your home going all day and all night?
sentences.chinese: 你家的電梯時連天帶夜的“上上下下地享受”啊？

sentences.english: With a love that the winged seraphs of heaven Coveted her and me.
sentences.chinese: 我們愛得那樣深，連天上的天使，也把我和她嫉妒。
